intro: Psychotria rosmarinifolia, commonly known as the "Lavender Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant, lavender-colored flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid forests, thriving in shaded, moist environments. Psychotria rosmarinifolia is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
